sections.MISSION: Comanche Troop, 1st Squadron, 2CR conducts HE FAM FIRE for the M320 at RG105 on 27AUG24 in support of Q4 range density IOT increase the lethality of the REGT and certify soldiers on their weapon system in preparation for live fire exercises
sections.PURPOSE: Increase the lethality of the REGT and certify soldier on their weapon systems in preparation for live fire exercises
sections.KEY TASKS: in this phase will be proper police call of the range, ammo turn in, and accountability of all personnel and equipment.
sections.EXECUTION: and range safety rehearsals. Phase 3: Will begin once all soldiers have completed the qualification and end when the range has been cleared IAW GTA Range Standards.
sections.COMMAND AND SIGNAL:
OIC: LT Shepler
RSO: SSG Soto
Ammo OIC: SGT Klemek
Primary Comms: Cell Phone
Alternate Comms: FM
Contingency Comms: JBCP
Emergency: Runner
sections.SUSTAINMENT:
CL V: 40MM HEDP LOWVEL (B546): 384 rds (13 rds/soldier)
Task to Subordinate Units
ALL: Provide NCOs to assist in coaching and training firers per 5 firers.
1 C: Provide OIC, RSO, Ammo NCOIC, safeties, and casevac
COMANCHE 320 HE FAM FIRE
sections.COORDINATING INSTRUCTIONS:
-Uniform dragoon standard.
-Ammo D/O: 0800
-Ammo P/U: 1700
HE Firing Point
Ammo Point
Range 105

values: Firer will fire in safe directions and will be monitored by lane safeties and RSO
Medic will be present at all times on the range.
Lane safeties will ensure safe firing procedures and weapon statuses.
All range safeties will perform a daytime walk through prior to night execution.
- Safeties Supervision - Safety clears weapon before leaving firing area - Leadership will ensure all Soldiers perform dry fire before live.
OIC, NCOIC, RSO, Safeties
Soldiers wear Full Dragoon Standard during execution.
Leaders continuously monitor Soldiers during execution to ensure proper shooting fundamentals.
Soldiers have been taught proper handling of weapons systems.
Ammo Point will fully separate all ammunition, spent and live.
Only ammunition for one iteration will be issued to the Soldier.
-Safety Brief, CONOP, Training Plan, PCC/PCI - Lane safeties check Soldiers prior to firing
OIC, NCOIC, RSO, safeties
Soldiers will be briefed on sector of fire for each lane
Range orientation brief will outline range boundaries
All weapon systems will remain static and on line at the firing line
Safeties will observe and call "cease fire" if gunner points weapon out of range boundaries
Orientation and safety brief, safeties on every lane
RSO, safeties
Sensitive items
accounted for prior to and
during training period
IAW WE SOP.
All issued sensitive
items tied down IAW
SOP.
Sensitive items
inventory conducted IAW
Squadron Recovery SOP.
Briefs, Inspections, Inventory, SOPs, PCC/ PCI
Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Loss of Communication with Range Control

values: If communication with
Range Control is lost,
Range will immediately
cease fire until
communication can be
returned with Range
Control.
DSN, Cell Phone, FM,
and Staff Duty will be
used to regain
communication with
Range Control
CONOP, Safety/Range Brief
OIC, RSO, NCOIC, Leaders
Range will cease fire if a fire erupts on the training range and will not go wet until all fire has been cleared from the range.
Any Solider that spots a fire will call the range to cease fire.
In the case of fire, range control will be called when prompted by the range meister to keep them abreast of the situation.
Fire fighting detail will remain ready will all PPE in the case that they must be deployed to retard fire.
Safety/Range Brief
All Soliders
Range will cease fire if any wildlife is on the training range and will not go wet until all wildlife has been cleared from the range.
Any Solider that spots wildlife will call the range to cease fire.
Safety/Range Brief
All Soliders
FLLs ensure Soldiers have packed appropriate ECWS components and have access to them during training.
FLLs conduct spot checks to ensure Soldiers use ECWS correctly.
Medics give refresher brief on signs of cold and hot weather injuries.

Medics are responsible for conducting spot checks and ensuring corrective action is taken for those who have or are showing signs of Cold Weather injury to included rotations into a heated vehicle or MEDEVAC (as necessary).
Camouflage face paint will not be worn when weather conditions are at or below 32 F.
Briefings, CONOP, PCC/PCI
NCOs, RSO, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Slips, trips, falls & other misc. injuries

values: Soldiers will execute Qualification in Full Dragoon Standard.
Soldiers climbing on top of tactical vehicles wear a helmet and maintain 3-points of contact.
No unharnessed Soldiers when vehicles are moving.
OIC/RSO understands and has briefed MEDEVAC plan on the real world casualty evacuation plan.
A designated vehicle will be marked properly for CASEVAC/MEDEVAC at the range tower.
Driver and Medic/CLS certified person will be briefed on routes, and strip maps with coordinates of AXP stored in vehicle.
Medic will carry medic certification paperwork at all times.
Driver and Medic will remain with MEDEVAC Vehicle at all times.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Rehearsals
Lane OIC/NCOIC, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Hazardous road conditions as a result of inclement weather (Heavy Rain, slippery roads, etc)

values: Vehicles adhere to all speed limits when operating around GTA according to GTA SOP.
Vehicles will reduce to speeds IOT allow safe operation of vehicle through terrain.
Vehicle movement formations maintain safe and proper following distances.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Roll-over Drills, Rehearsals, Concept of Medical Support
OIC, RSO, NCOs, VCs, Drivers
Leaders must ensure individuals who handle ammunition are trained on proper handling procedures and safety.
Soldiers must handle all ammunition with care.
Soldiers must wear eye protection and gloves while handing ammunition and crating/packaging material.
Leaders must enforce no smoking except in designated areas.
Have two (2) 10 pound fire extinguisher(s) on hand at ammo point.
Do not transport ammunition and personnel on same vehicle.
TACSOP, AR 385-64, DA PAM 385-64, AER 385-64, Risk reduction briefings, Leader Involvement. All Ammo Handlers Certified. AR/DA PAM 385-63/64 , Applicable FM/TM, or Accompanying Instructions
Ammunition NCO/OIC, Small Unit Leaders, Safeties

draw.overall_supervision_plan: I assess the overall risk to be medium as a result of an unlikely probability of a critical event; I assess the overall residual risk to be low due to critical severity of unlikely probability.Most Dangerous Risk: FratricideMitigation: Emplacement of range safeties, execution of proper PMI, and wearing Dragoon Standard PPE.Most Likely Risk: Negligent dischargeMitigation: Disciplined PMI prior to range execution, safeties ensure proper usage of M320 during TBLVI, RSO clears Soldiers at the clearing point.
